Identify the degree and the general shape of the polynomial.
Seek potential rational roots through the Rational Root Theorem by considering factors of the constant term, -1, over factors of the leading coefficient, 1.

Examine the structure of the remaining polynomial (if any) for patterns or possible further factorizations.
Repeatedly apply polynomial division for suspected factors based on observations until the polynomial is completely factorized.
Confirm that all factors multiply back to the original polynomial x^9 + x^4 - x - 1 to verify the correctness of the factorization.

Combine all the factors obtained from the above steps to write the full factorization of the polynomial \(x^9 + x^4 - x - 1\).
